definition: deep roots and vigorous foliage (idiom)/(fig.) well established and growing strongly
root/basis/classifier for long slender objects, e.g. cigarettes, guitar strings/CL:條|条[tiao2]/radical (chemistry)

sentences.english: Be deep rooted , flourishing and growing quickly.
Premier Wen said China-Pakistan friendship is deeply rooted, evergreen and vibrant.
sentences.chinese: 溫家寶說，中巴友誼根深葉茂，生機勃勃。

sentences.english: The father chicken farm next to a tree osmanthus trees, thick with leaves and deep-rooted.
sentences.chinese: 父親養雞場旁有一棵桂花樹，根深葉茂。

sentences.english: It has now grown into a giant tree with deep roots and rich fruits.
sentences.chinese: 如今這棵大樹根深葉茂，碩果累累。

sentences.english: China-Pakistan friendship is full of vigor and vitality, like a lush tree with deep roots and thick foliage.
sentences.chinese: 中巴友誼根深葉茂，生機勃勃。

definition: "the four classes" of ancient China, i.e. scholars, farmers, artisans, and merchants
to be at the highest level of enlightenment (Buddhist expression)
the hardships of beginning an undertaking (idiom)
to act in collusion (idiom); in cahoots with/villains will look after one another
so dedicated as to forget one's meals (idiom)
the State of Qǐ in modern Qǐ county 杞縣|杞县, Henan (c. 1500-445 BC), a small vassal state of Shang and Western Zhou for most of its existence
geographical position according to the principles of feng shui 風水|风水[feng1 shui3]/ley lines
to write a book advancing one's theory (idiom)
